content.raw:
I think we need to `include (FindPkgConfig)`. Otherwise the [gazebo REGRESSION_config-cmake test fails](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/22/testReport/%28root%29/Cmake/Config/).

content.raw: Should adding ruby as a dependency merit a major version bump to `sdformat3`? @\_jrivero_
content.html: Should adding ruby as a dependency merit a major version bump to sdformat3? @_jrivero_

content.raw:
I get compilation errors with gtest when I compile gazebo against this version of sdformat on my mac (both `gazebo5` and `gazebo5_erb` branches):
~~~
In file included from test/gtest/src/gtest-all.cc:45:
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:146:5: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'regfree'
    regfree(&partial_regex_);
    ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:147:5: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'regfree'
    regfree(&full_regex_);
    ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:156:3: error: unknown type name
      'regmatch_t'
  regmatch_t match;
  ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:165:3: error: unknown type name
      'regmatch_t'
  regmatch_t match;
  ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:179:51: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'REG_EXTENDED'
  is_valid_ = regcomp(&full_regex_, full_pattern, REG_EXTENDED) == 0;
                                                  ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:190:57: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'REG_EXTENDED'
    is_valid_ = regcomp(&partial_regex_, partial_regex, REG_EXTENDED) == 0;
                                                        ^
6 errors generated.
make[2]: *** [test/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/gtest/src/gtest-all.cc.o] Error 1
~~~
I uploaded the compiler command to a [gist](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/e0771f127b32706afbfb). Maybe the ruby headers are breaking gtest?
content.html:
I get compilation errors with gtest when I compile gazebo against this version of sdformat on my mac (both gazebo5 and gazebo5_erb branches):

In file included from test/gtest/src/gtest-all.cc:45:
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:146:5: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'regfree'
    regfree(&partial_regex_);
    ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:147:5: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'regfree'
    regfree(&full_regex_);
    ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:156:3: error: unknown type name
      'regmatch_t'
  regmatch_t match;
  ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:165:3: error: unknown type name
      'regmatch_t'
  regmatch_t match;
  ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:179:51: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'REG_EXTENDED'
  is_valid_ = regcomp(&full_regex_, full_pattern, REG_EXTENDED) == 0;
                                                  ^
test/gtest/src/gtest-port.cc:190:57: error: use of undeclared identifier
      'REG_EXTENDED'
    is_valid_ = regcomp(&partial_regex_, partial_regex, REG_EXTENDED) == 0;
                                                        ^
6 errors generated.
make[2]: *** [test/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/gtest/src/gtest-all.cc.o] Error 1

I uploaded the compiler command to a gist. Maybe the ruby headers are breaking gtest?

content.raw:
confirmed that manually removing the following include flags fixed the compilation:
~~~
-I/System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Headers
-I/System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Headers/ruby
~~~
Is there a way to compile gtest without including the sdformat include dirs? @\_jrivero_

weird...
content.html:
confirmed that manually removing the following include flags fixed the compilation:

-I/System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Headers
-I/System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Headers/ruby

Is there a way to compile gtest without including the sdformat include dirs? @_jrivero_

weird...

content.raw:
More precisely, removing the following flag fixes the problem:
~~~
-I/System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Headers/ruby
~~~
here are the contents of that folder:
~~~
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   7972 Sep  9 14:31 config.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   3360 Sep  9 14:45 debug.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   5553 Sep  9 14:45 defines.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel    881 Sep  9 14:45 digest.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   7628 Sep  9 14:45 dl.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel  14123 Sep  9 14:45 encoding.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel  32904 Sep  9 14:45 intern.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   5869 Sep  9 14:45 io.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   4522 Sep  9 14:45 missing.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel  37617 Sep  9 14:45 oniguruma.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   1502 Sep  9 14:45 re.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel    890 Sep  9 14:45 regex.h
lrwxr-xr-x  1 root  wheel      1 Jan 13 08:40 ruby -> .
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel  49734 Sep  9 14:45 ruby.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   4651 Sep  9 14:45 st.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel    374 Sep  9 14:45 subst.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   1102 Sep  9 14:45 thread.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   2139 Sep  9 14:45 util.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   1968 Sep  9 14:45 version.h
-rw-r--r--  2 root  wheel   1794 Sep  9 14:45 vm.h
~~~
The offending file is `regex.h`

content.raw: I think the offending include flag comes from the [cmake FindRuby module](https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/master/Modules/FindRuby.cmake#L212)
content.html: I think the offending include flag comes from the cmake FindRuby module

content.raw: I'm made some changes in ~~1d498048cf34~~ 43eac30 that resolve this issue for OS X; I'm currently waiting on a [jenkins trusty build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/23/) to confirm that it doesn't break trusty.
content.html: I'm made some changes in 1d498048cf34 43eac30 that resolve this issue for OS X; I'm currently waiting on a jenkins trusty build to confirm that it doesn't break trusty.

content.raw: The [jenkins trusty build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/23/) still works. Would you consider merging the changes in 43eac30 (branch parse_erb_2.0_scpeters) in order to fix OS X support?
content.html: The jenkins trusty build still works. Would you consider merging the changes in 43eac30 (branch parse_erb_2.0_scpeters) in order to fix OS X support?
